sense.name: Become or cause to become obstructed or to malfunction by virtue of a clog.
sense.examples: The leaves clog our drains in the Fall. Debris clogged up the water pipe. Despair clogged my mind. The author clogged the story with too many details.

sense.name: Coalesce or unite in a mass.
sense.commentary: NOTE: Compare to Sense 1; in Sense 2, there is no implication of a container or path becoming clogged. IS: CLOG TOGETHER
sense.examples: This would cause the red blood cells that are being attacked to clog together. Do not all of you clog together, roll on and take firm root, and from then on grow with grit, flower fruit and seed.

sense.name: Impede the motion of, as with a chain or burden.
sense.commentary: NOTE: Compare to Sense 1: in Sense 3, there is no container or path implied. NOTE: Generally applied only to animal training.
sense.examples: The horses were clogged until they were tamed.

sense.name: Dance a clog dance.
sense.examples: The troupe clogged at the festival.
